data.title: Metallurgical Engineer
data.description:
Location: Muskegon, MI

About SKF

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. SKF bearings played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface.

As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030. 

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Job Summary

This position is responsible for supporting a variety of Metallurgical services including metallographic and physical testing, product / process control testing and development, failure analysis, and problem solving. The incumbent also provides leadership and support for assigned programs and projects to ensure compliance with customer specifications, internal engineering standards, and AS9100 quality system requirements in a custom precision manufacturing facility.

Responsibilities

Provide ongoing metallurgical analyses and physical test results for production process control, product quality assurance, and provides product and material analyses.Review drawings, compare internal and external specifications against manufacturing processes, identifies gaps, and provides timely information to address discrepancies.Provide technical support to the manufacturing floor, including visual aids, instructions, inspection forms, etc., to support Production and Quality objectives.Conduct periodic Quality reviews and internal audits (Flight Safety, AS9100, Gauge R&R, Capability studies, PFMEA, etc.).Perform routine and non-routine audits on laboratory procedures and analyses ensuring high levels of accuracy in both testing procedures and evaluations.Serve as the resident “Subject Matter Expert” for Heat Treating and Chemical Processing activities with an emphasis on Nadcap requirements.Perform various tests including surface temper etch, macro- and microhardness, physical, and mechanical property testing.Monitors Heat Treat equipment to ensure that the requirements of any/all applicable industry pyrometry standards are met.Develop and maintain work instructions, processing parameters and processing methods conforming to customer and/or industry standards.Prepare metallurgical specimens for analysis, makes accept/reject decisions, and reports the results as required.Oversee the training, training requirement, qualifications, and skill enhancement of Metallurgical Laboratory and Heat Treat Technicians.Establish and enforce safe laboratory practices.Provide leadership, support, and guidance to other departments as necessary.Interface with customers on areas of expertise and responsibilities as required.Develop competencies in areas of interest, such as Advanced Quality techniques, Continuous Improvement, Process Development, scrap reduction, etc.Perform other duties as assigned, scheduled and/or required.

Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in Material Science or similar Engineering discipline, with one to three (1 to 3) years manufacturing experience.Background in metal removal, alloy steel thermal processing (thru-hardening, carburizing, temper, etc.), chemical processing, AMS2750, and Nadcap requirements preferred.Physically mobile and able to safely perform routine tasks (standing, sitting, bending, lifting up to 40 lbs).Must have a solid understanding of business, cost elements, and manufacturing processes.An advanced level of mechanical comprehension.Solid analytical problem-solving skills.Must be able to effectively interact with all levels of the organization both orally and written.Desire to develop competencies in areas of interest, such as Advanced Quality techniques, Continuous Improvement, Process Development, scrap reduction, etc.

What You’ll Love About SKF

Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a generous PTO policy and 13 paid holidays.

Work/Life Integration. SKF supports work/life integration, home, family, community, personal well-being and health. Flexible work options available, depending on role.

Diversity in the Workplace. At SKF, we strive to embed Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in everything we do. By developing a culture of belonging, our people can flourish; leading to an inclusive, equitable environment that promotes leadership, engagement, and innovation.

Best in Class Benefits. SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Comprehensive healthcare options to fit your needs and opt out payment. Added benefits include company paid life insurance, STD, LTD. Supplemental benefits include critical illness coverage, tuition reimbursement, employee discount programs, and much more!

Invest in your Future. Participate in our 401K program that boasts a 10% employer contribution: 100% match up to 5% of your elected contribution (100% Vested) plus an additional 5% company contribution.

Reports to: Quality Assurance Manager

Location: Muskegon, MI

Job ID: 19619

SKF provides equal employment [and affirmative action] opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

By applying to this job you acknowledge how SKF treats candidate data. Click HERE to review the SKF Data Privacy Consent Statement.

data.title: Application Engineer
data.description:
Location: Elgin, IL

About SKF: 

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer that&aposs dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth.

SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030.

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Job Summary:

Seeking a highly motivated, customer focused, and degreed engineer with dynamic rotating shaft seal knowledge and previous AE experience with customers. The Application Engineer will build strong Customer relationships and diligently drive new opportunities to aggressively grow the SKF North American Industrial Seals Business.

Job Responsibilities:

Operates as the main technical liaison between the Customer and SKF Industrial Seal Resources.Passionately drives New Industrial business growth both internally and externally in cooperation with the Customer, Sales, Business Development, and Engineering.Collaborates with Customer Engineers with and without sales as necessary to build relationships, utilize influence, discover opportunity, provide assistance and recommendations for new applications, overcome obstacles, and drive robust SKF Sealing SolutionsCommunicates regularly between Customer, engineering, sales, business development, manufacturing, purchasing, and quality on current projects.Procures and provides key information necessary for product design and product development to create optimized designs and mitigate risk for the Customer and for SKFCreates Tech Responses and Presents Technical Reviews for Customers.Provides technical assistance to customers for various applications in order problem solve and mitigate sealing system challenges.Collaborates with Product Development to ensure that new development projects will meet / exceed future customer expectations.Manages customer testing programs to meet customer specifications for getting new products approved by the customer.Provides necessary support documentation to the customer.Drives / Innovates for new or improved products and their applications.Utilizes influence, experience, personal contacts, and professional reputation to satisfy the customer and alert the SKF team to new SKF growth opportunities / competitive threats / needs for benchmarking and testing.Organizes/Presents at customer tech days to create growth opportunities.Trains the Customer in Seals Technology and Products.Works directly with the Customers and internal departments on field returns / warranty concerns / quality concerns.

Job Education, Knowledge, And Requirements:

4 years Mechanical Engineering degree or equivalent.Demonstrates knowledge of dynamic seal design and testing with specialized customer application engineering seal experience.Minimum of 2 year’s experience as Seals AE.Demonstrates initiative and creative ability.Must be able to translate design theory into practical application and follow project through successful completion including coordinating of efforts internally and with the customer.Exercises good discretionary decision making in line with corporate policy when dealing with customers or professional groups.Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to influence others.Exhibit good presentation skills.

Job Responsibilities:

Engineering specifications, seal specifications, DVPR&aposs.Tech Responses, Test Procedures, Validation Reports, customer correspondence, PDS (Product Data Sheets), Sample Orders, Tech Reviews.Technical contacts, purchasing, quality, managers.New products and plans, customer drawings, pending patents, development programs.Gives direction / input to product engineers, test lab engineers, material and product development groups, sales, quality, and manufacturing.Receives guidance in line with corporate objectives.

Work Environment:

Moderate physicalityStandard office conditionsSlight hazard in travel and test lab interactions

What You’ll Love About SKF:

Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a generous PTO policy and 13 paid holidays.

Work/Life Integration. SKF supports work/life integration, home, family, community, personal well-being, and health.

Diversity in the Workplace. At SKF, we strive to embed Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in everything we do. By developing a culture of belonging, our people can flourish; leading to an inclusive, equitable environment that promotes leadership, engagement, and innovation.

Best in Class Benefits. SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Comprehensive healthcare options to fit your needs and opt out payment. Added benefits include company paid life insurance, STD, LTD. Supplemental benefits include critical illness coverage, tuition reimbursement, employee discount programs, and much more!

Invest in your Future. Participate in our 401K program that boasts a 10% employer contribution: 100% match up to 5% of your elected contribution (100% Vested) plus an additional 5% company contribution.

Reports to: Applications Engineering Manager

Location: Elgin, IL

Job ID: 19543

data.title: Test Engineer
data.description:
Location: Plymouth, MI

About SKF

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. SKF bearings played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface.

As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030.

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Job Summary

To manage the execution of testing projects related to the validation of bearing and sealing systems and to support product development.

Job Duties and Responsibilities are (including but not limited to):

Review test requests for feasibility and propose test plan to meet customer needs.Review and apply testing specifications to meet test requirements.Design test fixtures and prepare detail and assembly drawings.Coordinate with external suppliers for tooling cost and timing.Participate in department resource planning meetings.Work with technicians to verify test rig setups are correct.Program test rig parameters and data acquisition systems.Collect test data and analyze test samples to document results.Troubleshoot test machine performance issues and assist in repair / improvements.Act as technical resource to application engineering and sales departments.Prepare test reports.Perform other duties as assigned.

Knowledge, Competence Requirements, And Desired Experiences

Ability to read and understand test specification and procedures.Effective verbal and written communication with global internal groups.Data acquisitions systems and statistical analysis.Root cause determination and post-test damage characterization.Mechanical testing experience with hydraulic and pneumatic test equipment.Experience with load cells, thermocouples, transducers, and measuring systems.Experience with project management and related software to manage project timelines.3D Parametric Design Software experience.Experience with LabVIEW software.Experience with bearings, Automotive chassis, Automotive powertrain systems, industrial, and/or agricultural systems.

Education And Experience Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering.Minimum of two years of experience in a testing laboratory or related technical field.

What You’ll Love About SKF

Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a generous PTO policy and 13 paid holidays.

Work/Life Integration. SKF supports work/life integration, home, family, community, personal well-being and health.

Diversity in the Workplace. At SKF, we strive to embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in everything we do. By developing a culture of belonging, our people can flourish; leading to an inclusive, equitable environment that promotes leadership, engagement and innovation.

Best in Class Benefits. SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Comprehensive healthcare options to fit your needs and opt out payment. Added benefits include company paid life insurance, STD, LTD. Supplemental benefits include critical illness coverage, tuition reimbursement, employee discount programs, and much more!

Invest in your Future. Participate in our 401K program that boasts a 10% employer contribution: 100% match up to 5% of your elected contribution (100% Vested) plus an additional 5% company contribution.

Reports to: Testing and Laboratory Manager NAM

Location: Plymouth, MI

data.title: PLM Engineer
data.description:
Knowledge Digitalization Engineer

Location: Plymouth, MI

Hybrid working scheme: 3 days in office, 2 home office.

Travel 10%

About SKF

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. SKF bearings played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface.

As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030.

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Job Summary

The Product Development and Engineering (PDE) NAM is part of Technologies development. This position plays a key role in establishing the SKF Vision “A world of reliable rotation”, by supporting the SKF Business Community in the management of Technical Product Information. As part of the PDE NAM Team, the Knowledge Digitalization Engineer develops and implements new configurations and designs automation solutions fitting the needs of our specific product line. This product line not only includes TSBB, SLB, but also Application Specific Offer based on DGBB, SRB or TRB or Agriculture bearings. The digital Product information twin being the single source of data, he/she is in charge of deploying data structure enabling further product data creation and consumption as; use of Design Automation tools we create, use of standards SKF Group provide, Modularization we create, integration and upgrade of the legacy documentation.

The Role Of The Knowledge Digitalization Engineer

This person will work closely with the product engineers, users of Design Automation; product engineers, product designers and others Design Automation colleagues enabling new solutions and digitalizing knowledge and designs rules. This person liaises between the bearing Knowledge team and the global PLM and digitalization roles. The role of a knowledge digitalization Engineer is to develop and implement the digital tools and to connect them within the product engineering workflow. These tools are specific to our product lines and use existing and proven design rules. The role of a product development organization being to develop new design rules, from which the digital engineer role is to maintain and update the existing tools to these new design rules as much as to the new recommendations enabling a smooth integration of these tools in the common SKF systems; Windchill, Creo from PTC, Simpro simulation software, Bearing Select software. This opportunity is a Hybrid working scheme: 3 days in office, 2 home office with 10% travel involved.

Responsibilities Include But Not Limited To

Develop and implement the digital tools and to connect them within the product engineering workflow.Own and maintain all tools specific to our PDE portfolio.Maintain and update the existing tools to these new design rules as much as to the new recommendations.Develop and maintain new recommendations enabling a smooth integration of these tools in the common SKF systems; Windchill, Creo from PTC, Simpro simulation software, Bearing Select software.Develop, codes these tools according to global guidelines provided by the global organization.Test and publish all tools.Aggregate the tools workflow.Maintain documentation training on our tools and provide daily support.Interface with the PLM team and software with ability to communicate about the product data structure and data flow.Execute User Acceptance Tests.Hybrid working scheme: 3 days in office, 2 home office.Travel 10%

Key Job Interfaces & Interactions (Typical)

Local SKF product engineers: Daily, they are the source of the knowledge to capture and the system and tool users to automatize the design.Local designers: daily, they design what cannot be automated, keeping a smooth continuum between what is automated and what is not is part of the mission.Global Design Automation department, data master owner and PLM department: FrequentlyFunctional Manager: Frequently

Job Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in mechanical engineering stream with Software interest or the other way around.5-6 Years of relevant functional work experience, can be split between Mech and SoftwareKnowledge on PLM (preferred PTC windchill) & CAD (preferred PTC CREO) platform.Coding experience.Abstraction ability to code mechanical design rules into Main Language; VBA, Python, WinDev..Ability to identify and define transfer function from existing KL patterns.Experience in Design Automation, ideally in mechanical industry.Ability to write programs in an object-oriented language like C++, C# or Java, Python, WinDev, VBA.Working knowledge of any Bug tracking & End user support tool.

Job Skills And Knowledge

Ability to see structures and patterns in complex problems, learning appetite.Engineering Mechanical knowledge is needed.Knowledge on Bearings is an advantage.Experience of Configurator tools is a plus (CPQ solutions).Execute User Acceptance Tests.Understand of Product Engineering and Design process as Request for Quotation, Design revision control.Understand the product master data creation.Being an individual contributor.Highly motivated & self-initiator with good communication skills with the ability to work effectively in a team environment locally and remotely.Ability to work within a fast-paced environment, delivering results.Ability to stand up to propose and defend technical solution, with short- and long-term views.

What You’ll Love About SKF

Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a generous PTO policy and 13 paid holidays.

Work/Life Integration. SKF supports work/life integration, home, family, community, personal well-being, and health. Flexible work options available, depending on role.

Diversity in the Workplace. At SKF, we strive to embed Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in everything we do. By developing a culture of belonging, our people can flourish; leading to an inclusive, equitable environment that promotes leadership, engagement, and innovation.

Best in Class Benefits. SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Comprehensive healthcare options to fit your needs and opt out payment. Added benefits include company paid life insurance, STD, LTD. Supplemental benefits include critical illness coverage, tuition reimbursement, employee discount programs, and much more!

Invest in your Future. Participate in our 401K program that boasts a 10% employer contribution: 100% match up to 5% of your elected contribution (100% Vested) plus an additional 5% company contribution.

Reports to: Global Manager PD and Engineering

Location: Plymouth, MI

Job ID: 19251

SKF provides equal employment [and affirmative action] opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

By applying to this job you acknowledge how SKF treats candidate data. Click HERE to review the SKF Data Privacy Consent Statement.

data.title: Quality Engineer
data.description:
Due to the nature of the business, candidate must be a US Citizen

Location: Hanover or Lansdale, PA

About SKF

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. SKF bearings played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface.

As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030.

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Job Summary

This position is responsible for providing leadership and support on assigned programs and projects ensuring the Company's products are manufactured in accordance with specifications. Serve as a liaison between customer, vendor (s), and company on quality-related concerns. This position will report to the quality manager (mounted products).

Responsibilities Include But Not Limited To

Develop and maintain supplier audit systems. Create and maintain Process Flow, Process Control Plans, and FMEA. Ensure adherence to the highest standards in castings, (gray / ductile iron, steel and aluminum), machining, paint, and assembly. Collaborate with suppliers to improve their quality processes and procedures. Focus on continuous improvement and operational excellence. Review and analyze supplier performance metrics. Identify areas for improvement and work collaboratively to address issues. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement quality assurance processes for incoming materials. Utilize Quality Management Systems. Investigate customer complaints and issue corrective actions. Lead root cause analysis investigations to prevent reoccurrence. Develop and maintain documentation including supplier quality manuals, quality plans, and reports. Review and approve supplier part submission; PPAP, ISIR, FAI. Facilitate the resolution of quality issues involving suppliers and internal teams to ensure customer satisfaction. Support new supplier qualifications, including initial assessments and ongoing performance monitoring. Participate in the development and review of specifications for castings. Ensure compliance with regulatory and industry standards, including ISO 9001. Interface with Sales, Customer Solutions, and Applications Engineering. Communicate changes in production plan based on customer requirements. Assist with performing quarterly supplier reviews. Assist in product audits and supplier audits. Assist with customer returns (TER’s). 

Working Environment And Conditions

Office environment with regular visits to manufacturing and supplier facilities. Travel may be required up to 30% of the time. Willingness to travel domestically and internationally to supplier sites as needed. Must have valid USA Driver’s License for travel purposes. 

Job Education, Experience, And Qualifications

US Citizenship is required due to the nature of work. Bachelor’s degree in Materials Science, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field from an accredited university. A minimum of 5 years of experience in quality engineering, with a focus on foundries, machining, paint processes and assembly. Proficiency in using quality tools such as FMEA, SPC, APQP, PPAP, and MSA. Familiarity with quality management systems such as ISO 9001, IATF 16949, or similar. Professional certification such as ASQ Certified Quality Engineer (CQE) is a plus. Demonstrated experience in supplier development and management. 

Preferred Qualifications

Comprehensive understanding of casting processes, material properties, associated standards, and specifications. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to lead root cause analysis investigations and develop viable solutions. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work collaboratively with internal teams and suppliers. Experience working with global suppliers and understanding of international quality standards Knowledge of SKF Quality Management Systems. 

What You’ll Love About SKF

Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a generous PTO policy and 13 paid holidays.

Work/Life Integration. SKF supports work/life integration, home, family, community, personal well-being and health. Flexible work options available, depending on role.

SKF Celebrates Diversity in the Workplace.  We strive to embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in everything we do. By developing a culture of belonging, our people can flourish; leading to an inclusive, equitable environment that promotes leadership, engagement and innovation.

Best in Class Benefits. SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Comprehensive healthcare options to fit your needs and opt out payment. Added benefits include company paid life insurance, STD, LTD. Supplemental benefits include critical illness coverage, tuition reimbursement, employee discount programs, and much more!

Invest in your Future. Participate in our 401K program that boasts a 10% employer contribution: 100% match up to 5% of your elected contribution (100% Vested) plus an additional 5% company contribution.

Reports to: Quality Manager

Location: Hanover, PA

Job ID: 19185

SKF provides equal employment [and affirmative action] opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

By applying to this job you acknowledge how SKF treats candidate data. Click HERE to review the SKF Data Privacy Consent Statement.

data.title: Manufacturing Engineer
data.description:
Summary:Our award-winning client is seeking a Manufacturing Engineer II to join their team. In this critical role, you will play a pivotal role in optimizing our manufacturing processes for success.
 Responsibilities:Facilitate technical team meetings and spearhead projects utilizing methodologies like DFA (Design for Assembly), PFMEA (Process FMEA), A3 Problem Solving, and Design of Experiments.Identify and implement innovative solutions to enhance manufacturing quality, reliability, and cost-effectiveness.Design, plan, and implement safe, high-quality, and cost-effective equipment and processes, ensuring smooth integration into production.Collaborate with the Lean/CI team to develop efficient processes and standard work instructions that optimize output, minimize defects, and elevate product quality.Take functional ownership of item routings, work instructions, and process flow documentation, ensuring accuracy and clarity.Support new product development initiatives, driving Design for Manufacturability and Assembly (DFMA) best practices.Review technical documents and create drawings in SolidWorks or similar CAD software to support manufacturing processes.Apply Lean Manufacturing principles to streamline operations and reduce waste.Create and update information for Bills of Materials (BOMs) and routings within the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system.
Required Qualifications:Minimum 5 years of experience in a manufacturing environment.Hands-on experience working with electronics or electro-mechanical products.Bachelor's degree in Engineering or a related technical field (or equivalent experience).Welding, brazing, and/or soldering experience is a plus.

data.title: Mechanical Engineer
data.description:
Job Summary

We are seeking Mechanical Engineers with Metals experience to join a successful International Manufacturer based in Cleveland, OH!

Engineers are responsible for helping to provide product engineering services, including new product development, product modifications, and technical services. They'll help develop product parameters, specifications, and engineering drawings too.

Here's what you need to bring!

Bachelor's in Mechanical Engineering 2-10 years of exp with product development / application engineering Exp with Creo/Pro-E or SolidWorks Project management skills

Competitive pay + bonus + excellent benefits package!

location: Cleveland, Ohio

job type: Permanent

salary: $67,000 - 90,000 per year

work hours: 8am to 4pm

education: Bachelors

Responsibilities

Provide technical support to Marketing and Manufacturing for existing product offerings. Evaluates alternative materials for cost reductions/improved performance. Helps with new product development and product modification work. Helps to develop product parameters, specifications, and engineering drawings. In conjunction with his supervisor and the Purchasing Department, works with vendors concerning tooling and part fabrication issues. In the product development process helps consider:regulatory issues safety regulations application procedures quality acceptance criteria verification analysis design review requirementsHelps provide technical performance data necessary to support the sale of new and modified products. Helps extend, after proper testing and engineering evaluation, existing products to affect greater use by customers. Helps modify products to do specialized jobs required by customer and deemed necessary by marketing or engineering. Helps in handling field complaints and product failures. Helps analyze problems, solutions, or recommendations after proper engineering and laboratory studies. Consults with Materials Engineer to determine causes of material failures. Works with Production, Quality Assurance, and Materials Engineer in helping determine acceptable quality and resolving problems of questionable quality of products. Helps interpret engineering recommendations, customer specifications, and engineering drawings. Attends technical meetings, conferences, and specialized courses consistent with area of responsibility. Is capable of developing and conducting material test procedures to comply with industry and customer specifications. Prepares and performs analysis in support of product development. Uses Pro-E, SoildWorks design, or Auto-Cad software.
Qualifications

Experience level: ExperiencedMinimum 2 years of experienceEducation: Bachelors (required)

Skills

Mechanical DesignEngineeringCreoAutoCADProject ManagementSolidworksMechanical EngineeringProfessional EngineerMechanical DesigncastingmetalscomponentsCADProduction

Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.

At Randstad Digital, we welcome people of all abilities and want to ensure that our hiring and interview process meets the needs of all applicants. If you require a reasonable accommodation to make your application or interview experience a great one, please contact HRsupport@randstadusa.com.

Pay offered to a successful candidate will be based on several factors including the candidate's education, work experience, work location, specific job duties, certifications, etc. In addition, Randstad Digital offers a comprehensive benefits package, including health, an incentive and recognition program, and 401K contribution (all benefits are based on eligibility).

Applications accepted on ongoing basis until filled.

data.title: Mechanical Engineer
data.description:
Summary: 
Our award-winning client is seeking a Mechanical Engineer to join their team. Join our dynamic team at MPI as a Mechanical Engineer and play a key role in creating innovative machinery! In this collaborative role, you'll develop mechanical designs, oversee projects, and actively participate in our LEAN culture to optimize processes and drive efficiency.
Responsibilities: 
Design and develop mechanical components for our machinery, ensuring they meet project specifications.Oversee mechanical aspects of projects, collaborating with electrical engineers and managing production support.Create detailed project documentation, including bills of materials and user manuals.Participate in daily LEAN meetings, identify areas for improvement, and help streamline mechanical processes.
Required Qualifications: 
Bachelor's degree + 4-5 years of mechanical design experience (machine tools a plus).Strong understanding of mechanical design principles, drawing practices, and tolerances.Experience working with machine tools, electrical, and hydraulic systems.Proficiency in SolidWorks and Microsoft Office.Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.Commitment to LEAN principles and continuous improvement.

data.title: Cloud Engineer
data.description:
Job Description:Principal Duties and Responsibilities:Applies Software knowledge to assist and support the design, development, creation, modification, and validation of embedded and cloud edge software, applications, and/or specialized utility programs.Analyzes user needs and software requirements.Designs and implements small software features for products and systems.Participates in the design, coding for small features, unit testing, minor debugging fixes, and integration efforts to ensure projects are completed on schedule.Assists in performing code reviews and regression tests as well as the triaging of issues to ensure the quality of code.Collaborates with others inside project team to accomplish project objectives.Writes technical documentation for Software projects.Cloud engineer to develop cloud-based applications & services, design & implement unstructured cloud data (S3) I/O & processing and optimize engineering data pipelines and implement data security for Product Development and Test Engineering department.
Top 5 Required Skills:2 + years of work experience with Python, C#, Shell scripting.Experience with databases PostgreSQL.Experience with AWS Elastic Beanstalk, Aurora Serverless PostgreSQL + S3 + Glue + Athena + File gateway + IAM + Lambda.Experience developing Data Warehouse and schema support.Good Communication Skills.
Technologies:2 years or more experience with databases PostgreSQL.1 year or more experience with AWS Elastic Beanstalk, Aurora Serverless PostgreSQL + S3 + Glue + Athena + File gateway + IAM + Lambda.1 year or more experience developing Data Warehouse and schema support.
Required Education:Bachelor’s degree in engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field.

data.title: Manufacturing Engineer
data.description:
Location: Dexter, MI

About SKF: SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. SKF bearings played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface.

As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030.

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Job Summary:Aero Engine Division of SKF manufactures super precision bearings for industrial and aerospace safety critical applications. The Manufacturing Engineer is responsible for supporting manufacturing operations to achieve business plan goals while driving continuous improvement using Lean Manufacturing principles. This position will interface directly with all levels of manufacturing and will be accountable for the principal job functions listed below.

Job Duties and Responsibilities are (including but not limited to): Maintain engineering standards, routing, BoM, etc. in ERP system.Provide technical support and troubleshoot manufacturing issues.Develop routings, work instructions and manufacturing visual aids.Work closely with Operations to develop process and technology improvements (e.g., safety and quality improvements, productivity enhancements, cost reduction ideas involving automation, special tooling, equipment modifications and improved work methods).Oversee the development and improvement of production processes.Identify and implement process capability improvements.Effectively manage multiple projects achieving cost, performance, and delivery expectations.Actively participate in team-based problem solving and continuous improvement initiatives (Kaizen, 5 Why, 6 Sigma, Value Stream Mapping, SMED, etc.).Develop, evaluate, and implement employee suggestions, line side reviews and employee driven continuous improvement activities.Prepare reports with recommendations on manufacturing and inspection methods, equipment and personnel requirements, time, and cost comparison of various courses of action.

Competencies and Skills Requirements: Six Sigma experience-Blackbelt a plus.Structured problem-solving skills.Track record of process improvement and cost reduction.Proficient using AutoCAD or Fusion 365.Familiar with Microsoft Office 365 Power Platforms.Experience with ERP systems.Familiar with basic machine controls.Proficient implementing process control methodologies.Effective communication and presentation skills.Strong analytical ability and initiative.Manufacturing experience – comfortable working with cross-functional teams and actively supporting the production team.

Education and Experience Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree (B.S.) in Mechanical, industrial, Manufacturing Engineering, or Manufacturing Technology.Minimum of 5 years of manufacturing experience.

What You’ll Love About SKF:Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a generous PTO policy and 13 paid holidays.

Work/Life Integration. SKF supports work/life integration, home, family, community, personal well-being and health.

Diversity in the Workplace:

At SKF, we strive to embed Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in everything we do. By developing a culture of belonging, our people can flourish; leading to an inclusive, equitable environment that promotes leadership, engagement, and innovation.

Best in Class Benefits. SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Comprehensive healthcare options to fit your needs and opt out payment. Added benefits include company paid life insurance, STD, LTD. Supplemental benefits include critical illness coverage, tuition reimbursement, employee discount programs, and much more!

Invest in your Future. Participate in our 401K program that boasts a 10% employer contribution: 100% match up to 5% of your elected contribution (100% Vested) plus an additional 5% company contribution.Reports to:

Engineering ManagerLocation: Dexter, MIJob ID: 19524SKF provides equal employment [and affirmative action] opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.By applying to this job you acknowledge how SKF treats candidate data. Click HERE to review the SKF Data Privacy Consent Statement. PandoLogic. Keywords: Manufacturing Engineer, Location: Dexter, MI - 48130

data.title: Electrical Engineer
data.description:
Electrical EngineerUpgrade your resume prior to applying with resumeandcareerservices.com. 
This client is a prominent figure in the industry. A leader in innovative building solutions, is seeking a skilled Electrical Engineer (PE) to enhance our dynamic team. This role will be based out of our offices in various locations. 
The chosen candidate will be involved in the design, development, and documentation of sophisticated electrical systems for residential, commercial, hospitality, and institutional projects. This role calls for a communicative and engaging individual with comprehensive expertise across the entire electrical design lifecycle, including initial planning, detailed modeling, specification drafting, project oversight, and support during construction phases. The successful applicant will need to possess excellent interpersonal abilities and be prepared to fulfill these expectations."
This Role Offers:• Generous base salary and comprehensive benefits - medical/dental/vision insurance, IRA with contribution, PTO, and more!• Ample opportunities for growth and upward mobility as the company continues to grow.• High visibility within the team and the ability to make an impact on the company’s direction.• Culture of high performance and quality customer experience.
Focus:• Design and develop comprehensive electrical systems using Autodesk Revit, ensuring integration with architectural designs and other building systems.• Work collaboratively with architects, interior designers, and engineering consultants.• Engage in all phases of the electrical design process from planning and modeling to specification and construction support.• Specialize in low voltage power distribution, with a preference for knowledge in medium voltage distribution, standby/emergency power systems, and advanced energy systems including solar PV and battery storage.• Participate in project meetings, providing electrical design expertise and technical support.Skill Set: • Professional Engineer (PE) license in MN, MT, WY, CO, TX, FL, CA, and/or WA.• Minimum of 8 years of experience in electrical design.• Proficiency in Autodesk Revit and familiarity with other electrical design software.• Strong understanding of electrical codes and standards.• Excellent communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills.• Ability to independently manage multiple projects and tasks simultaneously.• Creative and innovative approach to problem-solving.• Detail-oriented with a commitment to quality.
About Blue Signal: Blue Signal is a leading executive search firm, specializing in lighting recruitment. Our lighting recruiters have deep industry expertise finding top talent in areas such as lighting design, engineering, product development, and sales leadership. Learn more at bit.ly/3KlfEDn

data.title: Automation Engineer
data.description:
Description:Amgen Manufacturing and Clinical Supply (MCS) – Facilities & Engineering (F&E) Automation team, is looking for Engineers to support Clinical & Commercial Plant Automation programs and Capital projects, including complex and challenging automation initiatives that require a solid understanding of various automation platforms, integration between different platforms, analytical problem-solving techniques, project management, product lifecycle management, and operational excellence.They will require an extensive understanding and background in capital construction projects, design, programming, implementation, and lifecycle management of manufacturing process controls, automation, and field instrumentation technologies.
Job Responsibilities:Lead a team of Automation engineers responsible to support and deliver on complex capital construction projects including Global Lifecycle Asset Management (GLAM) projects. Lead the direct reports including External Workers (EWs), onboarding the EWs, and ensuring the direct reports’ adherence to Amgen training requirements.Represent ATA Plant Automation team during the development of project plan, business case, and cost estimates in partnership with key customers and stakeholders – ATO MCS Plant Operations, Engineering, Operations Information Systems (OIS), Global Construction Project Management (GCPM), and provide necessary support to obtain funding approval.Based on project scope, work with OIS to estimate manhours and required resources using Manufacturing Information and Technology System (MITS).Represent ATA Plant Automation team and participate in the preparation and implementation of detailed design, scope, schedule in partnership with Engineering and GCPM.Represent ATA Plant Automation team during the project implementation of new automation solutions including DeltaV Distributed Control System (DCS), Rockwell Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC), Human Machine Interfaces (HMI) and Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition systems (SCADA) related hardware, software, network infrastructure, and electronic Rt-reporting scope across various projects.Represent ATA Plant Automation team during the post-implementation activities including operationalization of the new assets by extending hyper-care support, training the System Owners, and Manufacturing team, revising the SOPs, and training documents, delivering spare parts list, updating Maximo assets and Amgen CMDB systems.Ensure compliance to Amgen Engineering and Operational standards, specifications, and procedures as applicable during the project design and implementation.Represent ATA Plant Automation team and support functional area projects focused on improving process equipment/utilities/facilities -to- large/sophisticated capital projects to integrate new drug substance and drug product manufacturing technologies into clinical/commercial facility.As applicable to the capital project scope, represent ATA Plant Automation team and support new product introductions (NPI) or new technology introductions by performing automation engineering assessments, implementing automation system configuration changes, and supporting engineering and process qualification runs.Manage day-to-day support of ATO Drug substance operationsSupport a safe working environment by complying with all pertinent environmental health/safety practice, rules, and regulations.Available for up to 10% domestic/international travel.
Preferred Qualifications:Degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science, Chemical Engineering, Biotech Engineering, or related life science engineering.Knowledge and experience in capital project lifecycle management including conceptual design, scope, resource estimate & cost estimate development, business case development, detailed design, engineering, commissioning, validation, and project execution, as it relates to Plant Automation and process control systems with GMP biopharmaceutical production facility equipment/systems in support of Drug Substance, Drug Product and Supply chain plant operations.Has five or more years combined experience with the following automation systems:Emerson Delta-V DCS system.Rockwell Automation SCADA and PLC Platform.Electronic Batch Reporting Systems Design and implementation experience.Process Control Network design including network segregation.Process Control Systems: Virtual Infrastructure design and implementation.System Integration using OPC, Foundation Fieldbus, Profibus, and DeviceNet technologies.Compliance to regulatory requirements such as 21 CFR Part 11, ASTM 2500, S88, S95 and GAMP.
Preferred Competencies:Proficient in project management skills.Ability to influence and motivate others outside of direct line of authority.Strong ability to interface effectively with all levels.Effective meeting management.Quick learner; proactive; takes initiative.Results oriented and goal driven.Ability to organize, interpret, communicate, and/or present information.Proficient facilitation, negotiation, problem-solving, and conflict resolution skills.Strong oral and written communication skills.Demonstrates willingness to put in extra effort when necessary to pursue tasks and conclusion.

data.title: Security Engineer
data.description:
Job Title: Security Operations Engineer (2) - Cloud Security — (14233819)Location/Onsite/Remote: On-site 3x/ week: Phoenix, AZContract/contract to hire and Contract Length: 18 month contract, strong potential to extend or convert to Full Time EmploymentStart Date: 7/1/24
Looking for a Cloud Security Engineer with experience with NetSkope, Palo Alto Prisma, or Crowdstrike. Other Posture Management Tool experience would be acceptable.
Python and/or Powershell experience is preferrable.Open to relocation candidates, must work hybrid in Phoenix, AZ
Start date is July 1st, 2024
  The Cloud Security Engineer will join the Cloud Security Operations Team as a central point of contact for Schwab Cybersecurity Services and act as a resource for technology related to cloud security controls. They will maintain & support Endpoint Detection & Response of SaaS applications & Cloud infrastructure resources that support business and security strategies, identify and manage threats, and protect intellectual property and client data in cloud applications.  What you are good at  The successful candidate’s primary responsibilities will include but are not limited to administration and engineering support for the Firm’s SaaS Security Posture Management (SSPM) and Cloud Security Posture Manage Platforms.  8+ years’ experience of IT system administration is preferred, with strengths in some or all of the following technical areas:  Experienced with Infrastructure as Code frameworks such as: Terraform, CloudFormation, and Kubernetes Operating systems and user administration (Windows and Linux) - Scripting: Windows and Linux shell, Python, and/or PowerShell On and Off Premise IaaS engineering and automation experience. Proficient in REST API development TCP/IP networking technologies within large enterprise environments, such as DNS, SMTP, HTTP and Syslog - Proxy, Secure Web Gateway (SWG), and/or web application firewall services SSO Federation and authentication technologies (OAuth, OpenID, SAML 2.0, MFA, Active Directory, etc.) - Encryption technologies and their implementations Requirements gathering, system analysis, system development, incident handling, change management, and implementation on a large-scale enterprise level Experience with creating and optimizing metrics, log analysis, and creating cohesive, audience focused reporting and dashboards from disparate data sources is highly desired. Excellent English verbal and written communications skills with the ability to partner and collaborate with other teams effectively across the enterprise. General Senior Technology Engineer skills such as:• Ability to think and work independently • Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve complex business and technical problems related to information risk • Technical writing experience Strong MS-Office skills, including PowerPoint, Word, and Excel  Applications • Netskope, Palo Alto Networks Prisma (preferred) or exposure to any other Cloud Access Security Broker/SaaS Security Posture Management (CASB/SSPM) and Cloud Security Posture Management Tools (CSPM) • Cloud Service Providers (Saas): AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure (any of these or other is fine)  Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment & Orchestration • Plan, Track & Support: JIRA, Remedy • Code, Build & Ship: BitBucket/GITHub, Bamboo • Infrastructure as Code: SaltStack, Ansible, Terraform, CloudFormation, and Kubernetes
 Programming Languages • Python • PowerShell • .NET • BASH • JAVA

data.title: Maintenance Engineer
data.description:
Job Summary

Primarily responsible for the overall maintenance of the hotel’s building and grounds and for the operation of its equipment and mechanical/electrical systems. Key responsibilities include keeping all equipment in good repair with a minimum of downtime by providing day-to-day maintenance of the hotel and completing maintenance work orders from all departments on a timely basis by following hotel’s standard operating procedures.

Essential Job Functions

This description is a summary of primary responsibilities and qualifications. The job description is not intended to include all duties or qualifications that may be required now or in the future. The Hotel operates 24 hours a day and 7 days a week, so operational demands require variations in shift days, starting times, and hours worked in a week.

Troubleshoots and repairs malfunction in mechanical or electrical systems (e.g., HVAC, plumbing) and other equipment throughout the hotel.Performs preventative maintenance assignments on a schedule basis (e.g., “room care”).Services the hotel’s pool, including adjusting chemicals and cleaning filters; completing maintenance request forms and record logs.Maintains the building exterior and “curb appeal” (e.g., lawn care, painting, and gardening).Adheres to all company policies and procedures.Follows safety and security procedures and rules.Knows department fire prevention and emergency procedures.Utilizes protective equipment.Reports unsafe conditions to supervisor.Reports accidents, injuries, near-misses, property damage or loss to supervisor.Provides for a safe work environment by following all safety and security procedures and rules.All team members must maintain a neat, clean and well groomed appearance. (Specific standards outlined in team member handbook).Assists other Engineering Personnel when needed.Perform any related duties as requested by supervisor/manager.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

The Hotel may consider equivalent combination of acceptable education and experience providing the knowledge, skills and abilities cited below, when applicable

Knowledge of all maintenance trades, including basic electrical, plumbing, mechanical and carpentry.Basic mechanical aptitude for operation and repair of hotel equipmentMust be able to recognize potential safety hazards and security problems in the hotel and act upon each accordingly.Be willing and able to comply with hotel policies and procedures including appearance and grooming, safety, security, key control and emergency procedures.Be skilled in several areas such as HVAC, electrical, carpentry, dry walling, painting, plumbing, roofing, and landscaping.Must be able to troubleshoot and repair routine mechanical and electrical malfunctions in hotel systems and equipment.Skill in the use of basic hand and electric tools and familiarity with parts and materials is required.Any combination of education and experience equivalent to graduation from high school or any other combination of education, training or experience that provides the required knowledge skills and abilities. High school diploma preferred.Thorough knowledge of the layout of the building, sleeping and function rooms.Ability to effectively deal with internal and external customers, some of whom will require high levels of patience, tact and diplomacy to defuse anger and collect accurate information.Ability to listen effectively, speak, read and write English clearly, as there will be interaction with guests and other team members.Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, sometimes under pressure, while remaining flexible and efficient while maintaining a pleasant cheerful demeanor.Ability to follow written and or verbal instructions.

 PHYSICAL DEMANDS 

Ability to stand, walk and/or sit and continuously perform essential job functions for duration of shift.Must be able to work in hot, cold, and wet conditions and be able to stoop, kneel, crawl, and climb on all types of surfaces.Hearing and visual ability to observe and detect signs of emergency situations.Ability to climb stairs and ladders at a rapid pace, up to 30 feet in the air.Grasping, lifting and holding tools and having good finger dexterity is required.Perform tasks requiring bending, stooping, kneeling, and walking significant distances between and within buildings on the property.Lifting and moving objects up to 100 pounds.Frequent twisting, bending, stooping, reaching, standing, walking, talking, hearing, seeing, and smiling. 

Apply Now

data.title: Infrastructure Engineer
data.description: Role: IT Infrastructure EngineerLocation: 38 Jackson Rd, Devens, MA 01434Duration: 12+ MonthsShift: Mon-Fri 8am-5pmPay rate: $67-72/hr. Summary:The Shared Services Infrastructure Engineer in Devens has responsibility to execute Lifecycle management and Digital Modernization related project for supporting Cell Therapy operations. The incumbent will work to protect our operations in manufacturing with increased need for resources to support digital innovation, business continuity, and cyber security. Responsibilities:Work in Shared Services team, and participate infrastructure project with digital plant teams, enterprise architect team, IT operations team, and cyber resilience team.Collaborate with partners and customers, such as Manufacturing, Facilities, MS&T, Supply Chain, and Quality to get alignment and endorsement on operations and resilience related initiatives.Execute projects of Digital Modernization and Lifecycle Management in Cell Therapy Manufacturing.Provide status reports of manufacturing resilience related deliverables.Participate in risk assessment activities to evaluate new and existing threats or vulnerabilities in Digital Plant, and prepare for remediation.Understand and promote site compliance with latest enterprise Cybersecurity guidelines, and provide input to site risk assessments.Maintain manufacturing IT architecture, infrastructure, and documentation.Ensure data quality of local IT assets inventory.Participate recovery verification activities including High availability and Onsite Application Recovery exercises. Requirements:Education: Bachelor degree in technical field or IT certificates, with 10+ years of experiences of managing IT infrastructure and applications.Knowledge of data center operation and IT infrastructure.Knowledge of network connectivity, network services, and network security.Hands on experiences of managing Windows Operating Systems, Windows Domains, Active Directory, and Group Policy.Hands on experiences of supporting Windows PC, Thin Client, mobile devices, and peripherals.Experience of patching of Operating Systems and applications, firmware upgrade, and Cybersecurity tools.Experience of managing Acronis backup and ThinManager.Ability to effectively communicate with both technical team and non-technical team.Ability to respond to urgent request and live troubleshooting.Ability to work on an on-call basis or overtime when required.Ability to work in a diverse group.Ability to manage multiple priorities with tight timeline.Basic project management skills.Excellent documentation and technical writing skills.Demonstrated creative problem-solving skills.Strong self-management skill and ability to work independently.Strong interpersonal skills in teamwork and collaboration.Good customer service skills.Understand regulatory and compliance in GMP requirements.Understand computer system validation.Strong attention to safety a must.Experience in pharmaceutical manufacturing is a plus. “We are an equal opportunity employer. It is our policy to provide employment, compensation, and other benefits related to employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, national or ethnic origin, disability, veteran status, age, genetic information, citizenship, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law.”

data.title: Thermal Engineer
data.description:
LHH Recruitment Solutions is seeking an experienced Thermal Engineer for a client in the aerospace industry, located in the Albuquerque, NM northeast area. This role will contribute to conceptualizing, evaluating, implementing, and managing thermal systems. Our client offers great benefits plus on-site perks which include a fitness area, shower facilities, a pickleball court, an outdoor dog kennel, and a relaxation zone complete with complimentary beverages and snacks. Daily company lunches are also prepared by an in-house chef. If this role sounds like it would be a good fit, submit an application for consideration!
Responsibilities:Undertake the creation and execution of Thermal and CFD simulations aimed at predicting fluid dynamics, heat transmission, and associated phenomena crucial to bolstering the evolution of the High-Elevation Platform Hub (HEPH).Execute analyses involving CFD and thermal aspects, with the intent of refining blueprints and elevating the efficiency and dependability of HEPH sub-systems.Engage in collaborative ventures with cross-disciplinary groups to seamlessly integrate CFD simulations into the design workflow.Maintain up-to-date familiarity with the latest strides in Thermal engineering methodologies and technologies, particularly those suited for the advancement of HEPH or analogous undertakings.Conduct rapid-turnaround manual and spreadsheet computations for instances where prompt results are requisite.Draft comprehensive technical documents and deliver presentations elucidating discoveries to invested parties.
Desired QualificationsA solid command of fluid mechanics, heat transfer, and pertinent principles as they relate to aerospace frameworks.Familiarity with programming languages like Python, Matlab, or C++.Acquaintance with avant-garde resolutions to existing thermal and flow predicaments encountered within aerospace contexts.Proficiency in utilizing CFD and thermal analysis software such as COMSOL or ANSYS Fluent.Outstanding prowess in troubleshooting and effective communication.Capability to operate autonomously while also contributing effectively to a multi-faceted collective.Preferred background in multiphase flow, reacting flow, and radiation thermal modeling within the aerospace arena.Highly desirable experience involving thermal experimentation and instrumentation.Preferred familiarity with FEA analysis software, with expertise in tools like Ansys Mechanical/ ABAQUS being a plus.
Education and Background:A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering or a closely related discipline.A minimum of 4 years of hands-on involvement in Thermal engineering and CFD, preferably in aerospace applications.

If this role sounds like a good fit for you, apply today!

data.title: Content Engineer
data.description:
Our Customer is a mission-driven not-for-profit organization that connects students to college success and opportunity. Founded in 1900, they were created to expand access to higher education. Today, the membership association is made up of over 6,000 of the world’s leading educational institutions and is dedicated to promoting excellence and equity in education. Each year, our Customer helps more than seven million students prepare for a successful transition to college through programs and services in college readiness and college success—including the SAT, the Advanced Placement Program, and BigFuture. The organization also serves the education community through research and advocacy on behalf of students, educators, and schools.

We are seeking a Content Engineer on a contract basis to help support our Customer’s business needs. This role is 100% remote.

As a Content Engineer you’ll be at the forefront of content architecture, strategy and execution for digital solutions across the product portfolio. You'll be a key member of cross-functional teams, bridging the gaps between design, content and engineering. You’ll work with product owners, UX/UI designers, engineers and content strategists. Your mission? To architect models making content more flexible, reusable and maintainable, and improving its presentation and structure. You’ll improve the authoring experience in Drupal CMS by defining UI and structural improvements.

What You'll Do

Content and Metadata Modeling (50%)

Develop and refine structured content and metadata models in the form of authoring templates, implementation specs, to enable delivery or evolution of new features and enhance content flexibility and reusability. Map the components of structured content and metadata throughout the delivery pipeline, ensuring alignment and data integrity from content creation to feature development to end user interaction. 

Content Management and Workflow (25%)

Contribute to the development of workflows and processes for creating and maintaining content Be the voice of the content creator at the company, ensuring that content workflows, lifecycles, and supporting tools are sustainable Establish governance practices to maintain content quality and consistency. 

Content Strategy and Design (25%)

Synthesize user needs and business requirements to contribute to a clear, scalable strategy for deploying information in multiple formats across digital products Create strategies for reusing content across different channels and contexts. Design, test, and implement effective and innovative content-driven digital experiences in the products, in collaboration with UX/UI design and research Determine when and how to leverage the use of structured content, and implement content management solutions to support delivery of key information to users 

Must-haves:

2-3 years’ experience designing content or data models and workflows for digital products Experience with Drupal or a similar CMS, beyond just creating and editing content. Modifying/creating content types, understanding fields and relationships, familiarity with headless/decoupled usage Familiarity with structured data (JSON and XML) is a plus Excellent problem-solving skills, including using data to inform recommendations Strong verbal and written communication skills, and an ability break down complex concepts for a non-technical audience using data, words, and visualizations Strong negotiation skills and a willingness to collaborate and find middle ground A self-starter mentality—you enjoy getting into the weeds, untangling complex ecosystems and learning new technologies Proven ability to build relationships and influence others to action Passion for supporting educational and career opportunities for millions of students 

Please note: In order to create a safe, productive work environment, our client is requiring all contractors who plan to be onsite to be fully vaccinated according to the CDC guidelines. Prior to coming into our offices, contractors will be required to attest that they are fully vaccinated.

An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

data.title: Software Engineer
data.description:
Job Description

We are the movers of the world and the makers of the future. We get up every day, roll up our sleeves and build a better world -- together. At Ford, we’re all a part of something bigger than ourselves. Are you ready to change the way the world moves?

Ford Motor Credit Company is seeking a software engineer to join its Customer Domain team. As a software engineer on this team, you will design, implement, maintain and evolve our java-based backend applications to meet both internal and external customer expectations. You will leverage your extensive technical experience to solve complex problems, guide projects through implementation and deployment, and mentor team members. With your learner’s mindset, you will grow and develop as an engineer, as a team member, and as a champion for Ford.

Back-end Software Engineer on Customer Domain team working at Ford Motor Credit Company. The ideal candidate will apply Agile software development practices to deliver products using domain driven design techniques and developing a distributed system architecture.

Responsibilities

In this position... 

Back-end Software Engineer on Customer Domain team working at Ford Motor Credit Company. The ideal candidate will apply Agile software development practices to deliver products using domain driven design techniques and developing a distributed system architecture.

What You'll Do...

 Design, build, deploy, operate and monitor highly available, testable and portable software solutions using Domain-Driven Design models with hexagonal architecture and behavior-driven development (BDD). Coach teammates on design patterns and software engineering practices in your areas of specific expertise. Create data strategies based upon Event Sourcing and CQRS techniques, leveraging platforms to suit the needs of internal and external clients. Lead and guide the disaggregation of requirements into implementable work within an Agile-based work process. Contribute to the shared learning of the team and broader organization.


Qualifications

You'll have... 

 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or similar technical discipline  At least five years experience software engineering  At least two years experience implementing software using Domain-Driven Design models.  Demonstrable experience with test-driven development (TDD), SOLID coding principles, and object-oriented design.  Experience designing, organizing and building critical systems.  Experience implementing software and data models using Event Sourcing and CQRS patterns is highly desired.  Experience with behavior-driven development (BDD)  Technologies / Skills: Java 8 or later, Spring Boot, GraphQL and REST, GCP, RDBMS and NoSQL platforms, Newman, Postman, N-unit, jmeter, gradle, event-driven architecture, pub/sub or kafka, Tekton, OpenShift, GitHub. Proficiency with MS Office and Rally/Jira are helpful.  Strong analytical and problem solving skills  Strong oral and written communication skills. 


Even better, you may have...

Desirable certifications include:

 GCP Associate Cloud Engineer  Apollo GraphQL Developer  OCP Java SE 17 Developer 


You may not check every box, or your experience may look a little different from what we've outlined, but if you think you can bring value to Ford Motor Company, we encourage you to apply!

As an established global company, we offer the benefit of choice. You can choose what your Ford future will look like: will your story span the globe, or keep you close to home? Will your career be a deep dive into what you love, or a series of new teams and new skills? Will you be a leader, a changemaker, a technical expert, a culture builder…or all of the above? No matter what you choose, we offer a work life that works for you, including:

 Immediate medical, dental, and prescription drug coverage Flexible family care, parental leave, new parent ramp-up programs, subsidized back-up child care and more Vehicle discount program for employees and family members, and management leases Tuition assistance Established and active employee resource groups Paid time off for individual and team community service A generous schedule of paid holidays, including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day Paid time off and the option to purchase additional vacation time.


For a detailed look at our benefits, click here:

2024 New Hire Benefits

This position is a range of salary grades 5-8 .

Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status. In the United States, if you need a reasonable accommodation for the online application process due to a disability, please call 1-888-336-0660.
